meanings.definition: In an overly emotional or exaggerated manner.
meanings.sent1: She melodramatically sobbed after watching the sad movie.
meanings.sent2: The actor melodramatically delivered his lines on stage.
meanings.sent3: He melodramatically pretended to faint when he saw a spider.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered melodramatically in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The child melodramatically declared that it was the end of the world when he dropped his ice cream cone.

meanings.definition: Exaggeratedly dramatic or emotional in behavior or speech.
meanings.sent1: Her melodramatically tearful performance moved the audience.
meanings.sent2: The melodramatically dressed woman entered the room with a flourish.
meanings.sent3: The melodramatically decorated cake looked like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: The melodramatically painted sunset filled the sky with vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The melodramatically written story kept readers on the edge of their seats.
